text: Polycera japonica is a species of sea slug, a nudibranch, a shell-less marine gastropod mollusc in the family Polyceridae.Bouchet, P. (2015). Polycera japonica Baba, 1949. In: MolluscaBase (2015). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species on 2017-01-09. == Distribution == This species was described from Japan. It also occurs in Hawaii and is widely distributed in the Indo- Pacific region.Pittman, C. & Fiene, P., (2016) Polycera japonica Sea slugs of Hawaii. ==References== Category:Polyceridae Category:Gastropods described in 1949
title: Polycera japonica
